page.title: 01Swansea
page.content:
{ }
The study block covers the area of central Swansea. It contains the whole range of land uses which make Swansea important. It includes the docks area, the commercial centre and some of the oldest residential areas. The name{Swansea}is derived from {'Sweyn's Eye'}marking the original Viking settlement. The{Welsh}name is {Abertawe}meaning{'at the mouth of the {River Tawe'.} Swansea is an historic centre with a Norman castle and a long established industrial background. It was created a{city}by the Queen in{1969,}investiture year. The present population is 185,000 and it is the administrative centre of West Glamorgan County Council.
